intro: Schizaea tenuis, commonly known as the slender chain fern, is a member of the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a perennial herb that grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. The plant has a rhizomatous structure with a long, creeping stem that produces aerial roots and sporangia. Its fronds are linear and often form dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Schizaea tenuis is characterized by its unique reproductive structures and is often found in association with other epiphytic plants.
